text.headline: Municipal Golf - Mobile, Alabama
text.text:
Linksman Golf Course will be a public municipal golf course located in Mobile, Alabama. It was designed by Ralph Sharp opening in 1972. Back tees on the course measures 6,275 yards and has a revised par of 70. Forward tees will measure 5416 yards. The course has water in play on 14 holes and is known for its location with views of the Dog River and Mobile Bay.

Linksman Golf Course has been closed since 2006. In 2021, Mobile County purchased the land for $850,000 with plans to rebuild the course.

Jerry Pate Design is the golf architect selected for the renovation of Linksman Golf Course. Pate is a former professional golfer who won the 1976 U.S. Open. He has also designed or renovated more than 20 golf courses, including the Country Club of Mobile and the Pensacola Country Club. Pate's design for Linksman Golf Course will retain the original character of the course, rebuilding to USGA specification greens, flatten tees, and a new irrigation system.

media.credit: NBC 15 / WPMI-TV - Mobile, Alabaama and Pensacola, Florida
